lessonInfo.title: Web Development Level 1 - Lesson 3
lessonInfo.description: Links, Images, and Introduction to CSS

parts.title: Part 1 - Creating Links
parts.description: Learn how to create hyperlinks using the anchor tag. Understand href and target attributes to link to other pages and control how links open.
keyConcepts: href attribute to specify link destination
target attribute to open links in new tabs

question1.text: Which tag is used to create a link in HTML?

question2.text: Which attribute specifies where the link should go?

question3.text: What value do you use for the target attribute to open a link in a new tab?

parts.title: Part 2 - Adding Images
parts.description: Learn about different image file types (GIF, JPEG, PNG) and how to add images to your webpage using the img tag with src and alt attributes.
keyConcepts: Image file types: GIF, JPEG/JPG, PNG
src attribute to specify image location
alt attribute for accessibility and descriptions

question1.text: Which image file type is best for images that need transparency?

options.text: All of them support transparency equally

question2.text: Which attribute specifies the path to the image file?

question3.text: What is the purpose of the alt attribute in an img tag?

options.text: To add a border to the image
To provide alternative text description for accessibility

parts.title: Part 3 - Semantic HTML
parts.description: Learn about semantic HTML tags that give meaning to the structure of your webpage, including header, footer, nav, main, and section tags for better organization and accessibility.
keyConcepts: What semantic tags are and why they matter
Structural tags: header, footer, nav, main, section
Organizing page layout with semantic HTML

question1.text: What is the purpose of semantic HTML tags?

options.text: To give meaning and structure to web content

question2.text: Which semantic tag is typically used for the top section of a webpage?

question3.text: Which semantic tag is best for navigation menu links?

parts.title: Part 4 - Introduction to CSS
parts.description: Get introduced to CSS (Cascading Style Sheets), the language used to style and beautify HTML elements. Learn how CSS works with HTML to create visually appealing webpages.
keyConcepts: What CSS is and its purpose
The relationship between HTML structure and CSS styling

question2.text: What is the main purpose of CSS?

options.text: To create the structure of a webpage
To add interactivity to a webpage
To style and format the appearance of HTML elements
To store data in a database

question3.text: How do HTML and CSS work together?

options.text: HTML provides structure, CSS provides styling
CSS provides structure, HTML provides styling
